data.question: What is the simplest isolated stable compound containing a phosphorus–carbon triple bond?
What method was used to synthesize Li(OCP) from Li[P(SiMe3)2]?
Is the (OCP)²⁻ anion described as a superposition of resonance structures?
What is the yield percentage based on phosphorus for the synthesis of [Na(OCP)·(dioxane)x]?
Can the alkali metal salts of the (OCP)²⁻ anion be briefly treated with water?
What reaction mechanism is proposed for the formation of the phospholide anion 5?
data.answer: The cyclic intermediate 3 b is in equilibrium with the acyclic phosphaketene 3 b’, which reacts further with a second equivalent of alkyne 2 b.

data.question: What was the observed 31P NMR resonance for the intermediate assumed to be 7?
Is the sodium salt of phosphinin-2-olate (11) stable in air or water?
What is the pKa value of phosphinin-2-ol (11 H)?
Does the reaction of Na(OCP) with α-pyrone 10 involve gas evolution?
What type of structural motif is common in the solid state structures of the sodium salt 4 a and the disodium salt 8?
Are the phosphorus-containing heterocycles in all compounds flat?
What is the NICS(1) value for phosphinin-4-ol indicating its aromaticity?
Does the deprotonation of phenol lead to a reduction in aromaticity?
What is the primary product formed by nucleophilic attack of the (OCP)²⁻ anion on the activated alkyne in the synthesis of phospholide anion 5?
What is the role of the (OCP)²⁻ anion in cycloadditions according to the text?
data.answer: It undergoes [2+2], [3+2], and [4+2] cycloadditions, initiated by a nucleophilic attack of the phosphorus atom.

data.question: Is the PC4 ring in the phospholide ring 5 coordinated to a metal center?
data.answer: No, it is not coordinated to a metal center.

data.question: What is the computed barrier for the monomolecular shift between 11 H and phosphinin-2(1H)-one?
What is the effect of the phosphorus atom on the aromaticity of the neutral or anionic ring systems?
data.answer: The phosphorus atom has no significant effect on the aromaticity of either the neutral or anionic ring systems.

data.question: Is the synthesis of Na(OCP) described as a simple one-pot procedure?
